required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Umbilical Cord Milking on Transition of Preterm Babies During Resuscitation
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Umbilical Cord Milking on Transition of Preterm Babies During Resuscitation

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators will evaluate if milking of umbilical cord in preterm babies will improve transition during resuscitation or not

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators will make milking for 100 preterm babies and placed them on warmer and assess heart rate,blood pressure,oxygen saturation,fio2,maximum pip,PEEP and 100 babies other without milking to see the difference between two groups.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two groups,one will have umbilical cord milking and other will have immediate cord clamping ,two groups will put on warmer after birth and blood pressure,heart rate ,oxygen saturation will be assessed by monitor every 30 seconds up to 10 minutes

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of all data will be assessed every 30seconds for ten minutes
primary_outcome.description: Measure mean blood pressure in mmhg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Heart rate will be assessed every 30 seconds for 10 minuets

arm_group.description: One group will have umbilical cord milking and will ba assessed for blood pressure,oxygen saturation and heart rate by monitor
One group will have immediate cord clamping and will be assessed for bloob pressure,heart rate,oxygen saturation by monitor

intervention.description: 100 babies will have squeezing of blood from umbilical cord towards baby

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- babies who need resuscitation
- Preterm babies with 28-34 weeks gestatinal age
Exclusion Criteria:
- preterm babies above 34 weeks gestational age, -- -
- refusal by mother or obestatracain, â€”- -babies with congenital anomalies
